sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. Find the Cartesian product (A x B) ∆ (B x A), where ∆ denotes the symmetric difference. Show that (A x B) ∆ (B x A) is not equal to (B x A) ∆ (A x B).
